intro: Leucheria lepida, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white powdery coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
